title: Newtons first law - forces applied to a box

content.question: Two students are pushing a <math alttext="10 kilogram" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext> kg</mtext></math> box with horizontal forces in opposite directions along a rough, horizontal surface. The magnitudes of these forces are <math alttext="24 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math> and <math alttext="60 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>60</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>. If the box is traveling with a constant velocity of <math alttext="3 meters per second" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mtext> m</mtext><mo>/</mo><mtext>s</mtext></math>, what is the magnitude of the frictional force exerted the box by the surface?

choices.label: <math alttext="6 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>6</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>
<math alttext="36 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>36</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>
<math alttext="84 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>84</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="36 newtons" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mspace width="0.4em"></mspace><mn>36</mn><mtext> N</mtext></math>

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
